name: wud
description: wud is a self-hosted Docker image watcher that monitors registries and running containers, notifying you about new image versions. It helps keep services up to date with minimal manual checking.
features: Container monitoring: Automatically detect running Docker containers and track their image versions.
Registry watching: Check Docker Hub, GHCR, and private registries for new image releases.
Update notifications: Send alerts via email, Slack, Discord, or webhooks when updates are available.
Version comparison: Compare running container versions against latest available tags in registries.
Semver support: Understand semantic versioning to identify major, minor, and patch updates.
Tag filtering: Configure which image tags to watch using regex patterns or specific version ranges.
Dashboard view: See all containers and their update status in a centralized web interface.
Multiple registries: Monitor images from different registries simultaneously in one instance.
Scheduled checks: Configure how frequently to poll registries for new versions.
Update triggers: Optionally trigger automated container updates via integration with Watchtower or similar tools.
Authentication support: Access private registries with credentials for proprietary or internal images.
Digest tracking: Monitor image digests to detect updates even when tags don't change.
